Comments
its pretty safe to walk around campus. if you dont feel safe you can always call to have a police escort you wherever you want to go.
the people who are in sororities and fraternities have the highest gpa on campus and always do fundraisers and events to raise money.
theres a whole bunch of clubs you can join. almost any club you can think of.
great for students who aren't afraid of new places,cultures, and schools. students who love to travel and experience new places. who can handle the cold and snow and rain.

here in new mexico they are big on green and red chili. they have that stuff every where and the majority here is native american so theres alot of that style here and everywhere you go theres new mexican food.
just a little. not too expensive but it still is a pretty big amount. i had to pay about $25000 and I still owe about $600
theres not much to do for fun here. only go watch a movie or hangout with friends. they have a huge mall here so going to a mall can always be an option.
the food in the cafeteria isn't the best but its all you can eat and it has pretty good food. they also have a student building where they offer places like sonics.
living in the dorms is great. it gives you a chance to meet new people and make new friends.
there not as big like most universities about academics. there pretty easy going on that.
be on top of everything like your financial aid and any accounts because you can be charged with something and you wont even know about it until its very late.
great school has many majors and programs to choose from. not as expensive as most schools. has many programs to help students if failing or need tutoring.
pageTitle: University of New Mexico (UNM) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {621434=In December around Christmas, students participate in the Hanging of the Greens. As students walk around the campus caroling, luminarias (traditional New Mexican Christmas lights) are lit throughout the entire campus along with decorations. Another tradition we have is the burning of the Aggie; our rival school's (NMSU) mascot. During Red Rally, the students build a giant Aggie and at the end of Red Rally week, we burn the Aggie down!, 363283=Casas del Rio, Redondo, and Hokona Hall, I would say are without a doubt the best dorms on campus. Also, Casas del Rio are new for the fall 2012 semester., 578210=Albuquerque is home, but I've heard if you are from out of state it is hard to adjust. I love it here, and can't wait to graduate in May of next year!, 831214=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 232871=Get good grades. Ask your parents to get their federal taxes done as early after Jan. 1st as possible (if you're a dependent) or get your taxes done asap after Jan. 1st (if you're independent). Complete and submit the FAFSA as soon after Jan. 1st also (definitely before March 1st, which is UNM's priority deadline to be considered for institutional scholarships) and apply to AS MANY scholarships as you can in the first quarter of the year., 88278=Every Fall we have Red Rally, which is the beginning of Homecoming Week. For Red Rally, we burn a giant NM State Aggie (our rival school). On May 4th, we have May the Fourth Be With You, which is big Star Wars festival on campus. We also have several international and culture festivals on campus, which provide great entertainment on your walk between classes.}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot I am learning a lot here at UNM. They are a top of the line school with excellent professors, GAs, and TAs. UNM has managed to find some of the mos interesting and qualified professors, GAs, and TAs. Last semester I took Philosophy 101 with Ethan Mills. He is a graduate student at UNM and teaches a few classes in the philosophy department. He has written a chapter in Steven Colbert's book I am America, and so can you. He made the class interesting and fun to many students (like myself) who have no interest in philosophy and were dreading the class. Ethan Mills is just one example, all of UNM's faculty are of his caliper, which makes attending UNM an educational and pleasureful activity. Login to rate or flag the reviews Mariah from Northern New Mexico 01/14/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 13 people found this review useful. 2 people found this inaccurate. 3 of 198 Categories Comments Tips for prospective students Tips
